sen.j: 中山 信吉（なかやま のぶよし、天正5年（1577年）- 寛永19年1月6日 (旧暦)（1642年2月5日））は、水戸藩附家老。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi NAKAYAMA (中山 信吉, 1577 - February 5, 1642) was a Tsukegaro (Karo [chief retainer] assigned directly by the shogun when the sons of the Tokugawa became daimyo) of the Mito domain.

sen.e: Nobuyoshi NAKAYAMA (1577 - February 5, 1642) was a Tsukegaro (Karo [chief retainer] assigned directly by the shogun when the sons of the Tokugawa became daimyo) of the Mito domain.

sen.j: 1577年、小田原北条氏家臣・中山家範（勘解由）の次男として生まれた。
sen.e: In 1577, Nobuyoshi NAKAYAMA was born as the second son of Ienori (Kageyu) NAKAYAMA, a vassal of the Odawara Hojo clan.

sen.j: 中山氏は武蔵国入間郡（現在の埼玉県飯能市付近）に本拠のある武藏七党の一つ。
sen.e: The Nakayama clan was one of Musashi-shichito Parties (seven parties of samurai in Musashi Province) who had the base in Iruma County, Musashi Province (the neighborhood of present-day Hanno City, Saitama Prefecture).

sen.j: 北条氏が武蔵国を押さえると家臣団に組み込まれる。
sen.e: When the Hojo clan conquered Musashi Province, the Nakayama clan was organized into the group of the vassals.

sen.j: 1590年、小田原征伐における八王子城攻防戦で家範は討死するが、戦後、兄照守とともに徳川家康に召し抱えられ、信吉は小姓役（1500石）として仕えた。
sen.e: In 1590, Ienori was killed in the offensive and defensive battle at Hachioji-jo Castle during the conquest and siege of Odawara, but after the war, Nobuyoshi and his older brother Terumori were employed by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and Nobuyoshi served at the post of a page (1,500 koku [of rice; 1 koku is approx. 180.39 liters]).

sen.j: 父子ともに八條流馬術の名手。
sen.e: Both his father and he were masters of Japanese equestrianism of the Hachijo school.

sen.j: 1607年、家康の11男頼房が下妻10万石に配されるに伴い、特に頼房に附属されて家老（6500石）に任じられる。
sen.e: In 1607, when Ieyasu's eleventh son Yorifusa was put in Shimotsuma with 100,000 koku, Nobuyoshi was specifically ordered to attend Yorifusa and appointed as a Karo (6,500 koku).

sen.j: 1609年、頼房の水戸転封により1万5000石に加増。
sen.e: In 1609, because Yorifusa was made to change the territory to Mito, Nobuyoshi had his stipend increased to 15,000 koku.

sen.j: 1616年には従五位下備前守に叙任、1621年には2万石に加増される。
sen.e: In 1616, he was appointed as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Bizen no kami (Governor of Bizen Province), and in 1621, he had his stipend increased to 20,000 koku.

sen.j: 翌1622年、常陸松岡（現在の茨城県高萩市）を居館を構えた。
sen.e: In the next year, 1622, he constructed the residence in Matsuoka, Hitachi Province (present-day Takahagi City, Ibaraki Prefecture).

sen.j: 伏見城内での盗賊捕縛や駿府城大火時における頼房救出など、信吉の正直な性格や人柄が家康の厚い信任を得ていたものと思料される。
sen.e: Considering that Nobuyoshi captured robbers in Fushimi-jo Castle or that he rescued Yorifusa when a great fire broke out in Sunpu-jo Castle, it is speculated that Nobuyoshi's honest nature and personality had gained Ieyasu's hearty confidence.

sen.e: Besides, it has been said that Nobuyoshi recommended Mitsukuni to Shogun Hidetada as a successor of the lord of the Mito Domain.
